newsitem.title: PERU: Peru says diplomacy its "weapon" against Ecuador.
newsitem.headline: Peru says diplomacy its "weapon" against Ecuador.

text.p: Peru plans to use diplomacy and not its newly purchased fighter planes against Ecuador as its "weapon" in their simmering border dispute, President Alberto Fujimori said on Monday.
"The weapon we want to prioritize is the weapon of international law, of dialogue," Fujimori said in a speech celebrating Peru's Army Day.

Denying media reports from Ecuador that Peru had a so-called "Victory Plan" to attack its neighbour after buying at least a dozen Russian fighter planes, Fujimori said Lima had instead a "Protocol Plan ... whose weapons are high-calibre arguments."
Since the Andean neighbours fought a brief border war at the beginning of 1995, they have been locked in peace negotiations over their disputed frontier.
The two sides set the border under the 1942 Rio Protocol treaty, but Ecuador later renounced the pact, saying it signed under pressure.

In October, Peru and Ecuador appeared to take a major step toward solving their decades-old dispute by agreeing to start talks, scheduled for Dec. 20 in Brasilia, for a final settlement over the remote strip of Amazon jungle.
Ahead of the countries' traditionally delicate December-February period, tensions flared up last month when Peru bought the MiG fighter jets.
Ecuador claimed the purchase was excessive and could lead to an arms race.
